Cuando los datos son escasos y la infraestructura es poco confiable, ‚Äúm√°s grande‚Äù no siempre es mejor. Ah√≠ es donde la IA ligera puede convertirse en una campeona para la salud.
Axell Albano Guti√©rrez Ram√≠rez es ingeniero biom√©dico y vio de cerca c√≥mo un diagn√≥stico inicial equivocado puede afectar a toda una familia.

En muchas cl√≠nicas rurales y de bajos recursos, los pacientes muestran se√±ales tempranas (temblores, cambios en la marcha, deterioro cognitivo), pero los especialistas est√°n a horas de distancia y las listas de espera se extienden por meses.

En esta charla, Axell comparte un camino distinto al hype de ‚Äúmodelos m√°s grandes + datasets masivos‚Äù: construir herramientas pr√°cticas de apoyo al diagn√≥stico que puedan correr en hardware b√°sico, funcionar sin conexi√≥n y aprender con decenas o cientos de registros de pacientes, no millones.

\#\# Lo que veremos
‚Ä¢ \*\*Cu√°ndo los pocos datos pueden ganar\*\* - C√≥mo los modelos simples y eficientes en datos pueden superar al deep learning en escenarios de datos limitados (y cu√°ndo no)
‚Ä¢ \*\*Dise√±o guiado por restricciones\*\* - Construir para el sistema de salud que existe (ancho de banda limitado, energ√≠a inestable, dispositivos b√°sicos), no para el de los papers
‚Ä¢ \*\*Explicabilidad √∫til para el personal cl√≠nico\*\* - Qu√© deber√≠a significar ‚Äúexplicable‚Äù en la pr√°ctica para apoyar decisiones, generar confianza y adoptar de forma segura
‚Ä¢ \*\*Del modelo al flujo de trabajo\*\* - C√≥mo convertir un prototipo en algo que un m√©dico general realmente pueda usar bajo restricciones reales
‚Ä¢ \*\*Equidad, l√≠mites y responsabilidad\*\* - C√≥mo ampliar el acceso sin sobreprometer: IA como apoyo, no como reemplazo

Basado en su investigaci√≥n de maestr√≠a en el CIC IPN, Axell recorrer√° un enfoque de prediagn√≥stico de Parkinson a partir del an√°lisis con IA de patrones geom√©tricos trazados a mano, algo que un m√©dico general puede aplicar con papel y un tel√©fono, sin infraestructura en la nube ni equipo especializado.

\#\# Sobre Axell
https://www.linkedin.com/in/axell-albano-guti%C3%A9rrez-ram%C3%ADrez-2a30b11a8
https://orcid.org/0009-0008-6197-5422
Axell Albano Guti√©rrez Ram√≠rez es ingeniero biom√©dico de M√©xico y actualmente cursa la maestr√≠a en Ciencias de la Computaci√≥n (MCIC) en el CIC IPN, en la Ciudad de M√©xico. Su tesis se enfoca en aprendizaje de m√°quina para apoyo al diagn√≥stico, espec√≠ficamente un sistema de prediagn√≥stico de la enfermedad de Parkinson mediante el an√°lisis de patrones geom√©tricos trazados a mano.

Su trabajo enfatiza IA pr√°ctica para la accesibilidad en salud: modelos ligeros adecuados para entornos cl√≠nicos de bajos recursos sin acceso a especialistas. Este a√±o, en Par√≠s, particip√≥ en el ICMV 2025, uno de los congresos internacionales a los que asisti√≥ para compartir avances de su investigaci√≥n sobre el uso de trazos como apoyo en el diagn√≥stico de Parkinson.

Ha presentado en congresos internacionales, incluidos CIESEM 2021, EDULEARN24 (Mallorca) e ICMV 2025 (Par√≠s, Francia), y ha sido coautor de trabajos sobre diagn√≥sticos basados en IA, defendiendo enfoques simples y eficientes en datos cuando los conjuntos disponibles son limitados.

\*\*Schedule\*\*
6:00 p.m. Doors & check-in
6:30 p.m. Conversation begins
7:15 p.m. Audience Q&A
7:30 p.m. Networking
8:00‚Äì9:30 p.m. After party at a nearby spot (5 min walk; indoor/outdoor, bring a jacket and your drinking/eating shoes)

When data is scarce and infrastructure is unreliable, ‚Äúbigger‚Äù isn‚Äôt better. That‚Äôs where lightweight AI can become a champion for health.
Axell Albano Guti√©rrez Ram√≠rez is a biomedical engineer who saw how a wrong initial diagnosis can ripple through a family. In many rural and low‚Äëresource clinics, patients show early signs (tremors, gait changes, cognitive shifts), but specialists are hours away and waitlists stretch for months.

In this talk, Axell shares a different path from the ‚Äúbigger models + massive datasets‚Äù hype: building practical diagnostic support that can run on basic hardware, work offline, and learn from dozens or hundreds of patient records, not millions.

We will cover his wins and losses. What he learned along the way and...
‚Ä¢ \*\*When small data can win\*\* - How simple, data‚Äëefficient models can outperform deep learning in limited‚Äëdata settings (and when they can‚Äôt)
‚Ä¢ \*\*Constraint-driven design\*\* - Building for the healthcare system that exists (limited bandwidth, unreliable power, basic devices), not the one in research papers
‚Ä¢ \*\*Explainability clinicians can use\*\* - What ‚Äúexplainable‚Äù should mean in practice for decision support, trust, and safe adoption
‚Ä¢ \*\*From model to workflow\*\* - Turning a prototype into something a general practitioner can actually use under real constraints
‚Ä¢ \*\*Equity, limits, and responsibility\*\* - How to expand access without overclaiming: AI as support, not replacement
Grounded in his master‚Äôs research at CIC IPN, Axell will walk through a Parkinson‚Äôs pre‚Äëdiagnosis approach based on AI analysis of hand‚Äëdrawn geometric patterns, something a general practitioner can administer with paper and a phone, without cloud infrastructure or specialized equipment.

\#\# About Axell
https://www.linkedin.com/in/axell-albano-guti%C3%A9rrez-ram%C3%ADrez-2a30b11a8
https://orcid.org/0009-0008-6197-5422

Axell Albano Guti√©rrez Ram√≠rez is a biomedical engineer from Mexico currently pursuing his master's degree in Computer Science (MCIC) at CIC IPN in Mexico City. His thesis focuses on machine learning for diagnostic support, specifically a pre‚Äëdiagnostic system for Parkinson‚Äôs disease through analysis of hand‚Äëdrawn geometric patterns.

His work emphasizes practical AI for healthcare accessibility: lightweight models suitable for low‚Äëresource clinical settings without access to specialists. This year, in Paris, he took part in ICMV 2025, one of the international conferences he attended to share progress in his research on using hand‚Äëdrawn strokes to support Parkinson‚Äôs diagnosis.
He has presented at international conferences including CIESEM 2021, EDULEARN24 (Mallorca), and ICMV 2025 (Paris, France), and co‚Äëauthored work on AI‚Äëdriven diagnostics, advocating for simple, data‚Äëefficient approaches when datasets are limited.

Kong/MEXICO-CITY
[AI is reshaping enterprise connectivity‚Äîturning it into a strategic lever for speed, cost control, and competitive advantage.](https://konghq.com/blog/news/the-age-of-ai-connectivity)

The problem is fragmentation. Most organizations have different tools, policies, and teams managing each connection point in their AI data path. The result: latency compounds, costs spiral, and governance becomes impossible at scale.

Join Kong CEO Augusto Marietti and CTO Marco Palladino for a candid conversation on how to unify your entire AI data path‚Äîfrom agents to models to tools‚Äîand move from pilot experiments to production scale. You'll also hear from SVP of Product Reza Shafii and Head of Product Marketing Alex Drag on what's new and what's coming in 2026: the Agentic Trust Layer, Agent Gateway, AI-native WAF, real-time data monetization, and comprehensive AI cost governance‚Äîthe infrastructure layer enterprises need to operationalize AI. Learn how to prepare your stack for the demands of AI-native architecture.

Whether you're building AI governance, controlling costs, or planning your next generation of AI infrastructure, this is where the decisions that define the next decade get made.

Sigui√≥ iterando hasta que corri√≥ en una Raspberry Pi.
Si la pausa universitaria se vuelve permanente, qui√©n sabe.
Es un emprendedor serial. Su primera startup es Styla, integrando tecnolog√≠a NFC directo en la ropa usando materiales reciclados y amigables con el ambiente. Fueron los primeros en lograrlo de verdad, metiendo tecnolog√≠a sin contacto en prendas, no solo en tarjetas de presentaci√≥n. El proyecto se expandi√≥ a organizadores de cables, stickers personalizados, soluciones anti-metal, y etiquetas de papel, eventualmente consiguiendo un cliente en Victorio Forti.
A los 15 compet√≠a en nacionales representando a CDMX como nadador. Cuando hizo las cuentas sobre cu√°nto dura una carrera de nataci√≥n y c√≥mo eran las probabilidades realmente, se fue por lo acad√©mico.

Two years ago, David Saavedra saw a real problem with AI and paused his degree at Tec de Monterrey to do something about it. He started building a small language model from scratch with no wrappers, no platforms. The first versions, a classic Goldilocks problem: too large to run locally, too limited to be useful, especially in Spanish. He kept iterating until it ran on a Raspberry Pi.
Whether the university pause becomes permanent remains to be seen.
He's a serial entrepreneur. His first startup is Styla, integrating NFC technology directly into clothing using recycled and environmentally friendly materials. They became the first to actually pull it off, embedding contactless tech in garments, not just business cards. The project expanded into cable organizers, custom stickers, anti-metal solutions, and paper tags, eventually landing a client in Victorio Forti.
At 15, he was competing at nationals representing CDMX as a swimmer. When the math became clear about how long a swimming career realistically lasts and what the odds actually looked like, he chose academics.
In this session, David walks through what actually happened: the early versions that didn't work, the trade-offs between size and capability, and what it takes to build something functional under real constraints. It's less about outcomes and more about the sequence of decisions that got him here, shaped by hard work and lessons from entrepreneurial parents.

description:
Weave-cli is a fast CLI for Weaviate, Milvus, Chroma, Qdrant, and other vector DBs to help view, list, create, delete, and search collections and documents in collections for development, test, and debugging purposes. Join us in this session and hear how why Max decided to create it and learn about its strengths and weaknesses for powering vector search for RAG, similarity search and other workloads

**About the presenter**
Michael Maximilien (aka ‚ÄòMax‚Äô or 'Dr. Max') is the founder and CEO of a ‚Äústealth‚Äù AI Agents startup in Silicon Valley. Before that he was an IBM Distinguished Engineer leading Open Source teams for AI agents and multi-agent systems. His career focused on pioneering software platforms, from early web services, to cloud computing, and more recently multi-agent systems. Max was a key OSS leader in the development of Cloud Foundry and Knative ‚Äî the Kubernetes serverless platform. His expertise in distributed systems is backed by over 100 published papers and 20 patents; and his PhD in computer science in 2005 was focused on multi-agent systems. Max is also a retired Ironman triathlete and an award-winning photographer.

**About the AI Alliance**
The [AI Alliance](https://thealliance.ai) is an international community of researchers, developers and organizational leaders committed to support and enhance open innovation across the AI technology landscape to accelerate progress, improve safety, security and trust in AI, and maximize benefits to people and society everywhere. Members of the AI Alliance believe that open innovation is essential to develop and achieve safe and responsible AI that benefit society rather than benefit a select few big players.

**Join the community**
Sign up for the [AI Alliance newsletter](https://thealliance.ai/community) (check the website footer) and join our new [AI Alliance Discord](https://discord.gg/YtsWdke6E9).

We‚Äôll explore what ‚Äúenterprise-grade AI‚Äù looks like in practice, how to bake governance and observability into every layer of your architecture, and why a modern API platform is emerging as the backbone of real-world AI systems.

description:
Meet [Semiont](https://the-ai-alliance.github.io/semiont/), the wiki-like knowledge base supporting graph retrieval, where humans and agents co-create Knowledge. Includes MCP server.

**About the presenter**
Adam Pingel ([LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/adampingel/), [GitHub](https://github.com/adampingel)) is IBM's Head of Open Tools and Applications for the [AI Alliance](https://thealliance.ai). Adam has been fascinated by AI and chatbots since playing with [Racter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Racter) in the 80‚Äôs. But the ‚Äúwinters‚Äù were long and frequent. The stars aligned in 2015 when he became VPE at Ravel Law. Ravel was building AI-powered tools for the legal industry and was working with Harvard Law School on what is now known as the Caselaw Access Project. After an acquisition by LexisNexis in 2017, he moved his family to Raleigh (in 2019) to take the role of CTO of Global Platforms. In 2022 he joined IBM to work on domain-specific applications of generative AI. Adam holds an MS and BS in CS from UCLA and Stanford, respectively. When not at a keyboard, he enjoys spending time with his family.

**About the AI Alliance**
The [AI Alliance](https://thealliance.ai) is an international community of researchers, developers and organizational leaders committed to support and enhance open innovation across the AI technology landscape to accelerate progress, improve safety, security and trust in AI, and maximize benefits to people and society everywhere. Members of the AI Alliance believe that open innovation is essential to develop and achieve safe and responsible AI that benefit society rather than benefit a select few big players.

**Join the community**
Sign up for the [AI Alliance newsletter](https://thealliance.ai/community) (check the website footer) and join our new [AI Alliance Discord](https://discord.gg/YtsWdke6E9).

title: kong-mexico-city|From Batch to Real-Time: The Business Case for Event Streaming|Online
description:
In today‚Äôs digital landscape, data that moves slowly is data that loses value. As organizations strive for instant insights, responsive experiences, and operational agility, batch processing can no longer keep up. Event streaming offers a transformative alternative‚Äîenabling continuous data flow, faster decision-making, and real-time responsiveness across systems and services.
In this session, we‚Äôll explore why leading enterprises are embracing event-driven architectures and how event streaming unlocks new business potential. You‚Äôll learn how real-time data pipelines drive innovation across industries, and how Kong‚Äôs Event Gateway brings consistency, observability, and governance to event-driven communication‚Äîbridging the gap between APIs and events for the modern enterprise.
What You‚Äôll Learn:

* Why organizations are shifting from batch to event-driven architectures‚Äîand the business outcomes they gain
* How real-time event streaming improves agility, time-to-insight, and customer experience
* Common challenges in scaling and governing event-driven systems‚Äîand how to overcome them
* How Kong‚Äôs Event Gateway unifies APIs and events under one control plane for consistency and visibility

title: big-data-developers-in-mexico-city|[AI Alliance] Gofannon: Ramen|France|Occitania
description:
Everyone is talking about agents; if you don't have agents already in production you are hopelessly behind. Wasn't vibe coding supposed to take care of everyone's computer problems? How am I behind if AI takes care of everything for me now? Maybe I need an MCP and then I'll be caught up. Wouldn't it be nice if there was a tool where I could just say what I wanted the agent to do and it would vibe it out for me? And then maybe I could tell it what I wanted the app to look like, and it would vibe that out too. That day is today, that tool is called gofannon.

In this talk we'll discuss our motivations for making gofannon, lessons learned that we've incorporated from prior iterations, and a (possibly live) demo where we'll go from idea to deployed app. See you there!

**About the presenters**
Trevor Grant (IBM)

**Andrew Musselman** is a seasoned technology leader with 20+ years of experience building scalable platforms and data-driven solutions. He is a builder with business focus, and has helped companies realize multiple millions of annual savings and revenue through innovation and modernization. Andrew has been an Apache Software Foundation contributor for over 12 years, and brings together the community-driven value of open source work with concrete business results, ranging from data engineering and platform development to cutting-edge AI solutions.

**About the AI Alliance**
The [AI Alliance](https://thealliance.ai) is an international community of researchers, developers and organizational leaders committed to support and enhance open innovation across the AI technology landscape to accelerate progress, improve safety, security and trust in AI, and maximize benefits to people and society everywhere. Members of the AI Alliance believe that open innovation is essential to develop and achieve safe and responsible AI that benefit society rather than benefit a select few big players.

**Join the community**
Sign up for the [AI Alliance newsletter](https://thealliance.ai/community) (check the website footer) and join our new [AI Alliance Discord](https://discord.gg/YtsWdke6E9).

description:
¬°Atenci√≥n Parroquian@s! üëã

Nos acercamos al cierre del a√±o y tenemos un Meetup muy interesante este mes.

Contaremos con la presencia de Francys Lanza Garc√≠a, Data Scientist en Bankaya, especializada en soluciones de Machine Learning para riesgo y fraude en servicios financieros.

**Motor de cr√©dito impulsado por IA en Bankaya**

¬øDe qu√© va la charla?

Bankaya desarroll√≥ un motor de decisi√≥n de cr√©dito de baja latencia que responde en segundos. Este motor utiliza fuentes de datos alternativas (eventos dentro de la aplicaci√≥n, geolocalizaci√≥n, se√±ales del dispositivo y transacciones en tiempo real) para evaluar perfiles con poco o nulo historial crediticio.

Este motor est√° construido sobre un Feature Store unificado capaz de servir features en batch y en streaming, con versionado, linaje y consistencia estricta entre lo que el modelo ve en entrenamiento y en predicci√≥n. Sobre esta infraestructura se ejecutan pipelines de CI/CD/CT que permiten entrenar, validar y desplegar modelos en horas, con validaciones offline/online, despliegues canarios y rollback seguro, garantizando paridad de entorno (dependencias, runtimes y vistas de features) entre desarrollo y producci√≥n.

Este motor ha mejorado la conversi√≥n, disminuido el riesgo del portafolio y acelerado los tiempos de aprobaci√≥n, a la vez que ha permitido implementaciones sin fricci√≥n con socios comerciales. Al automatizar los ciclos de entrenamiento y despliegue, el equipo libera tiempo para enfocarse en innovaci√≥n y nuevos productos, manteniendo el motor de cr√©dito actualizado ante cambios de comportamiento y de mercado.

\-\-\-

La cita es este pr√≥ximo **miercoles** 29 de octubre (2025) a las **7:00 pm (Hora de Ciudad de M√©xico)** en "Escuela de Gobierno y Transformaci√≥n P√∫blica del Tecnol√≥gico de Monterrey" [https://goo.gl/maps/eD5acVqaZ5MamH6T6](https://goo.gl/maps/eD5acVqaZ5MamH6T6) para aquellos que est√©n en la CDMX y tambi√©n estaremos haciendo streaming del evento por nuestro canal de YouTube:

title: kong-mexico-city|[Developer Day] Developer Portal, Observability & Identity with Kong Konnect|Online
description:
**[Register Here](https://konghq.com/events/webinars/developer-day-developer-experience-in-practice-developer-portal-observability--identity-with-kong-konnect)**

**[Developer Day] Developer Experience in Practice: Developer Portal, Observability & Identity with Kong Konnect**

In preparation for this Developer Day, check out the recordings from our Workshops leading up to it:

1. [Kong Konnect Automations 101: Introduction to API Platform-as-a-Service Concepts and Delivery Methods](https://konghq.com/events/workshops/kong-konnect-automations-101-introduction-to-api-platform-as-a-service-concepts-and-delivery-methods?utm_source=kong-email&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=community/)

2. [\[Workshop\] Kong Konnect Automations 201: APIOps in Action - Automating the API Lifecycle with Kong Konnect](https://konghq.com/events/workshops/workshop-kong-konnect-automations-201-apiops-in-action-automating-the-api-lifecycle-with-kong-konnect?utm_source=kong-email&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=community/)

This hands-on Developer Day builds on the first two workshops (Platform setup and APIOps automation) to deliver a complete developer experience. You‚Äôll stand up a Kong Konnect Developer Portal with self-registration and application onboarding, wire the portal to an OIDC identity provider for SSO and token issuance, and publish APIs and docs from your APIOps pipeline.

In parallel, you‚Äôll configure Konnect Analytics to capture metrics and usage data from your Kong gateways and services. By the end, platform teams will have clear guardrails and automation, while API and app teams get a governed, self-service path from discovery to secure consumption‚Äîbacked by actionable analytics.

**Key Takeaways**

* Configure the Konnect Developer Portal with self-registration, app credentials, and approval workflows.
* Integrate an OIDC IdP for SSO, role mapping, and token issuance for portal users and applications.
* Automate API and documentation publishing to the portal from your APIOps (GitOps/CI) pipeline.
* Set up Konnect Analytics to collect and visualize API consumption and performance metrics.
* Split responsibilities: platform teams provide guardrails and automation; API teams manage products and docs; app teams self-serve access.
* Produce a reusable reference implementation you can adapt to your organization‚Äôs environment.

title: big-data-developers-in-mexico-city|[AI Alliance] Connect On-prem Solutions via NLIP|Online
description:
This use case showcases how Natural Language Interaction Protocol (NLIP) could facilitate the integration of on-premises resources such as Active Directory with cloud providers such as ServiceNow. Special attention is paid to moderation of communications for signs of jailbreaking, etc. to combat some regular problems.

**About the presenter**

**Will Witten** is a pragmatic builder and customer educator focused on AI that actually ships and sticks. He specializes in translating plain-English requests into production-grade workflows, stress-testing designs to expose brittle spots before they reach users. A strong advocate for the **Natural Language Interaction Protocol (NLIP)**, he treats it as a practical bridge‚Äîstandardizing how systems converse while leaving room for each side‚Äôs constraints so results don‚Äôt break on contact with reality. Today he will share about his experience working with Natural Language Interaction Protocol, the latest standard for dependable natural language interactions, including a real-world example to demonstrate how this standard can benefit you. (edited)

**About the AI Alliance**
The [AI Alliance](https://thealliance.ai) is an international community of researchers, developers and organizational leaders committed to support and enhance open innovation across the AI technology landscape to accelerate progress, improve safety, security and trust in AI, and maximize benefits to people and society everywhere. Members of the AI Alliance believe that open innovation is essential to develop and achieve safe and responsible AI that benefit society rather than benefit a select few big players.

**Join the community**
Sign up for the [AI Alliance newsletter](https://thealliance.ai/community) (check the website footer) and join our new [AI Alliance Discord](https://discord.gg/YtsWdke6E9).

title: kong-mexico-city|Enable Business Agility Through The Lens of API Security|Online
description:
Today's API landscape is a labyrinth of multi-cloud, multi-gateway, and event-driven architectures, rapidly expanded by AI, LLM and MCP adoption‚Äîeach presenting new attack vectors. While security is often seen as a necessary cost, this session reframes API security as a critical enabler of business innovation and agility, not a punitive tax. Discover how robust API security practices enabled by Kong's modern tooling can accelerate, rather than impede, your digital transformation.

We‚Äôll show how Kong Konnect, as a unified platform, helps platform and security teams shift security left during API design, and enforce it at runtime through scalable governance, policy-driven request inspection, and continuous posture monitoring.

What you‚Äôll learn:

* How to embed security early in the API lifecycle via automation and policy templates
* How to enforce governance at runtime without slowing down innovation
* How to secure AI-powered APIs, handle multi-cloud complexity, and prepare for evolving threats
* Real-world practices from platform teams driving secure agility at scale
* Whether you're a security engineer, platform architect, or API product owner‚Äîthis session will equip you with a modern playbook for building trust without slowing velocity.

description:

6:30 Presentation starts
7:30-8 Networking

https://www.linkedin.com/events/fromacademiatoaistartup-buildin7378614789398269952/

Dr. Chaehan So
https://www.linkedin.com/in/chaehan-so-087261/

English Below
**Qu√© esperar:**

* Lecciones pr√°cticas sobre c√≥mo transformar un experimento de investigaci√≥n en una startup de IA para el acompa√±amiento.
* Ideas para quienes se interesan en la psicolog√≠a, la salud mental y la inteligencia artificial.
* C√≥mo el conocimiento psicol√≥gico gu√≠a la optimizaci√≥n de un chatbot de IA para la ansiedad.

**Puntos clave:**

* Demostraciones t√©cnicas con herramientas pr√°cticas para el desarrollo de chatbots.
* Perspectivas psicol√≥gicas sobre lo que realmente hace que las personas se sientan escuchadas en una conversaci√≥n.
* Por qu√© el mayor reto no es hacer a la IA emp√°tica, sino ayudar a los usuarios a hablar de sus dificultades personales.
* El cruce entre psicolog√≠a e IA:
* Comprensi√≥n de los efectos cognitivos
* El tri√°ngulo conducta‚Äìcognici√≥n‚Äìemoci√≥n aplicado a la optimizaci√≥n de prompts

Chaehan So es fundador de la startup de acompa√±amiento con IA **Virtual Friend**. Anteriormente trabaj√≥ como profesor de Psicolog√≠a del Dise√±o e Inteligencia Artificial Aplicada en la Universidad de Yonsei, Corea del Sur. Obtuvo su doctorado en Psicolog√≠a Social en la Universidad Humboldt de Berl√≠n, Alemania.
Su principal l√≠nea de investigaci√≥n ha sido aplicar m√©todos psicol√≥gicos y algoritmos de *machine learning* para analizar la percepci√≥n de los usuarios frente a la inteligencia artificial aplicada. Su mayor objetivo es crear experiencias de usuario fundamentadas en la psicolog√≠a.

***

**What to Expect:**

* Practical lessons from transforming a research experiment into an AI companion startup.
* Insights for people interested in psychology, mental health, and AI.
* How psychological knowledge guides the optimization of an AI chatbot for anxiety.

**Key Takeaways:**

* Technical demonstrations of practical tools for chatbot development.
* Psychological insights into what actually makes humans feel heard in conversation.
* Why the biggest challenge isn‚Äôt making AI empathetic‚Äîbut helping users open up about personal difficulties.
* The crossover from psychology to AI:
* Understanding cognitive effects
* Behavior‚Äìcognition‚Äìemotion triangle for prompt optimization

Chaehan So is the founder of the AI companion startup virtualfriend.chat. Previously, he worked as Professor of Design Psychology and Applied AI at Yonsei University, South Korea. He received his Ph.D. in Social Psychology from Humboldt University of Berlin, Germany. His main research interest lay in applying psychological methods and machine learning algorithms to analyse user perception related to applied artificial intelligence. His main aspiration is to create psychologically-grounded ways of user experience.

title: big-data-developers-in-mexico-city|[AI Alliance] How to Train Your LLM Web Agent: A Statistical Diagnosis|Online
description:
LLM-based web agents have recently made significant progress, but much of it has occurred in closed-source systems, widening the gap with open-source alternatives. Progress has been held back by two key challenges: first, a narrow focus on single-step tasks that overlooks the complexity of multi-step web interactions; and second, the high compute costs required to post-train LLM-based web agents.

To address this, we present the first statistically grounded study on compute allocation for LLM web-agent post-training. Our approach uses a two-stage pipeline, training a Llama 3.1 8B or QWEN 2.5 7B student to imitate a Llama 3.3 70B teacher or QWEN 2.5 72B via supervised fine-tuning (SFT), followed by on-policy reinforcement learning (GRPO).

We find this process highly sensitive to hyperparameter choices, making exhaustive sweeps impractical. To spare others from expensive trial-and-error, we sample 1,370 configurations and use bootstrapping to estimate effective hyperparameters. Our results show that combining SFT with on-policy RL consistently outperforms either approach alone on both WorkArena and MiniWob++. Further, this strategy requires only 55% of the compute to match the peak performance of pure SFT on MiniWob++, effectively pushing the compute-performance Pareto frontier, and is the only strategy that can close the gap with closed-source models.

Read the paper on ArXiv: [How to Train Your LLM Web Agent: A Statistical Diagnosis](https://arxiv.org/pdf/2507.04103) (PDF)

**About the speaker**

I‚Äôm Massimo Caccia, Senior Research Scientist at [ServiceNow Research](https://www.servicenow.com/research/), specializing in post-training methods for computer-use agents. I see computer use as the ultimate playground for testing agents, thanks to its ubiquity and diversity. My research involves conducting large-scale empirical studies to systematically evaluate trade-offs among different approaches and to develop practical know-how, with reinforcement learning being a particular focus.

As a core contributor to the web-agent research library ecosystem, I actively shape evaluation frameworks ([BrowserGym](https://github.com/ServiceNow/BrowserGym), [WorkArena](https://github.com/ServiceNow/WorkArena)) and development platforms ([AgentLab](https://github.com/ServiceNow/AgentLab)). My goal is to bridge foundational research and scalable tools to advance the field.

Previously, I completed my Ph.D. at the Quebec Artificial Intelligence Institute ([Mila](https://mila.quebec/en/)) under Professor [Laurent Charlin](http://www.cs.toronto.edu/~lcharlin/). During my doctoral studies, I collaborated with [DeepMind](https://deepmind.com/)‚Äôs Continual Learning team led by [Marc‚ÄôAurelio Ranzato](https://ranzato.github.io/), [Amazon](https://www.amazon.science/)‚Äôs team under [Alex Smola](https://alex.smola.org/), and ElementAI prior to its integration with ServiceNow.

My Ph.D. research focused on building agents capable of accumulating and transferring knowledge across tasks, drawing from continual learning, transfer learning, and meta-learning. My work explored applications in language, vision, and reinforcement learning, emphasizing improvements in data and compute efficiency.

**About the AI Alliance**
The [AI Alliance](https://thealliance.ai) is an international community of researchers, developers and organizational leaders committed to support and enhance open innovation across the AI technology landscape to accelerate progress, improve safety, security and trust in AI, and maximize benefits to people and society everywhere. Members of the AI Alliance believe that open innovation is essential to develop and achieve safe and responsible AI that benefit society rather than benefit a select few big players.

**Join the community**
Sign up for the [AI Alliance newsletter](https://thealliance.ai/community) (check the website footer) and join our new [AI Alliance Discord](https://discord.gg/YtsWdke6E9).

Through a candid discussion, we‚Äôll explore how platform teams can make sense of fragmented environments, set the right expectations for governance, and design strategies that empower developers without losing oversight.

description:
¬°Parroquian@s! üëã

Este mes tenemos un Meetup muy especial. Nos acompa√±a Hermilio Cort√©s, un viejo conocido del espacio e Investigador Asociado de la Escuela de Gobierno y Transformaci√≥n P√∫blica del Tec de Monterrey, quien nos ofrecer√° una charla t√©cnica sobre uno de los lenguajes de programaci√≥n m√°s populares por su desempe√±o, seguridad y modernidad: RUST.

**Integraci√≥n de Rust y Python con PyO3**

¬øDe qu√© va la charla?

En ocasiones nos gustar√≠a mejorar el desempe√±o y dise√±o del software disponible. Tendencias tecnol√≥gicas y lenguajes de programaci√≥n novedosos hace tentador a las empresas reescribir sus productos. Si algunas empresas han mostrado los beneficios en desempe√±o, seguridad y mantenibilidad de reescribir su software en un lenguaje nuevo, ¬øPor qu√© no hacer lo mismo? Reescribir software desde cero es una tarea dif√≠cil y riesgosa. El software existente puede tener a√±os de experiencia en producci√≥n y monitoreo, as√≠ como una base de conocimiento para identificar bugs.

Refactorizar es "reescritura en una menor escala". Es una t√©cnica m√°s controlada para mejorar el dise√±o y performance del software existente. En lugar de reemplazar al sistema actual por completo, nos gustar√≠a detectar partes del sistema latentes a ser reemplazados con la menor cantidad de c√≥digo posible para mejorarlo.

En esta pl√°tica se hablar√° acerca del por qu√© Rust es una alternativa eficiente, confiable y poderosa en el proceso de refactorizaci√≥n. De forma particular, se mostrar√° el uso del paquete PyO3 para ejecutar c√≥digo de Rust dentro de Python. **Polars en Rust** es una librer√≠a de an√°lisis de datos que combina la seguridad y velocidad del lenguaje Rust con un enfoque orientado a columnas, ideal para cargas de trabajo anal√≠ticas intensivas. Aprovecha las capacidades del sistema de tipos de Rust y su concurrencia para ofrecer un procesamiento de datos extremadamente eficiente y seguro en tiempo de compilaci√≥n. Es una opci√≥n para desarrolladores que necesitan velocidad, bajo uso de memoria y precisi√≥n en entornos donde la confiabilidad del sistema es cr√≠tica.

title: big-data-developers-in-mexico-city|Agent-to-Agent Interactions with NLIP and an application to AllyCat|Online
description:
**Description**
NLIP (Natural Language Interaction Protocol) is a project defining an interoperable protocol for user-to-agent and agent-to-agent natural language interactions. In this talk, Tom will describe the goals of the NLIP project and then demonstrate a proof of concept agent network built using NLIP. One of the agents is an AllyCat instance that has been modified by giving it an NLIP server. By adding NLIP to the AllyCat server, it is immediately available to Chat Clients and other Agents, making it part of an expanding network of agents.

**Speaker bio**

Tom Sheffler is a computer engineer currently working towards interoperability of secure agentic systems. He is also a solution architect with UnifabriX - a maker of CXL memory pooling systems for memory-bound HPC applications. Previously, Tom built global web applications for managing and scaling genomics computations at Roche. As an entrepreneur, he founded the cloud-based video analytics company, Sensr.net, that provided a consumer solution for home security cameras. Tom was an early employee at Rambus where he worked on the architecture and verification of high-speed memory devices.

**About the AI Alliance**
The [AI Alliance](https://thealliance.ai) is an international community of researchers, developers and organizational leaders committed to support and enhance open innovation across the AI technology landscape to accelerate progress, improve safety, security and trust in AI, and maximize benefits to people and society everywhere. Members of the AI Alliance believe that open innovation is essential to develop and achieve safe and responsible AI that benefit society rather than benefit a select few big players.

title: ai-cdmx|Beyond the Plateau: Rethinking AI in 2025|M√©xico|Ciudad de M√©xico
description:
Find the live stream at
https://x.com/ai_cdmx

Espa√±ol Abajo

Join us for a lively and thought-provoking conversation on the current state of the AI industry. As we move through 2025, large language models continue to evolve. Given this dominant paradigm, are we rapidly approaching AGI or seeing the first glimpses of a performance plateau? Considering approaches inspired by biology and systems theory, we'll explore the latest trends in research and how these intersect with the trajectory of the industry as a whole.

Our guest speaker, Blake McConnell, brings deep experience in building and deploying computer vision and AI systems at scale. We'll talk about what works (and what doesn't) when bringing AI into real-world workflows, and how to make smart, strategic decisions about AI adoption. Whether you're leading a startup or guiding transformation at a global company, this discussion will help you think critically about what "intelligent" really means in business today.
Expect insights, examples, and space for open discussion. Come curious!

Acomp√°√±anos en una charla din√°mica sobre el futuro de la inteligencia artificial y lo que significa para tu trabajo. En 2025, los modelos de IA siguen mejorando constantemente, pero surge una pregunta clave: ¬øestamos cerca de lograr una inteligencia artificial verdaderamente general, o ya llegamos a un l√≠mite fundamental? Exploraremos las tendencias m√°s recientes en investigaci√≥n de IA, incluyendo enfoques inspirados en sistemas biol√≥gicos, y analizaremos hacia d√≥nde se dirige la industria.

Blake McConnell, nuestro invitado especialista, tiene a√±os de experiencia desarrollando e implementando sistemas de visi√≥n computacional e IA en proyectos reales. Conversaremos sobre los retos pr√°cticos de integrar IA en procesos de trabajo cotidianos: qu√© estrategias funcionan, cu√°les no, y c√≥mo tomar decisiones inteligentes sobre cu√°ndo y c√≥mo adoptar estas tecnolog√≠as. Si lideras un proyecto, una startup, o trabajas en innovaci√≥n dentro de una empresa grande, esta pl√°tica te dar√° herramientas para entender qu√© significa realmente "inteligencia" en el contexto empresarial actual.

Habr√° casos reales, ejemplos pr√°cticos y mucho espacio para preguntas y debate. ¬°Trae tus dudas y curiosidad!

About Blake
[https://www.linkedin.com/in/blakelymcconnell](https://www.linkedin.com/in/blakelymcconnell)
Blake McConnell is an engineering technical lead specializing in computer vision and machine learning pipelines. His deep experience in this area comes from decades of building systems that leverage cutting edge technologies for creative pursuits and industrial applications.

As a Senior Lead Engineer at Cox Automotive/ Fyusion, he is an integral member of the research team responsible for the automated damage detection systems for used vehicles utilized in thousands of car auctions across the US. Over the course of his career, he's also created mixed-reality installations in a variety of venues including music festivals and public art spaces.

Blake McConnell es l√≠der t√©cnico en ingenier√≠a, especializado en visi√≥n computacional y aprendizaje autom√°tico. Su experiencia profunda en esta √°rea viene de decadas desarrollando sistemas que aprovechan tecnolog√≠as de punta tanto para proyectos creativos como aplicaciones industriales.

Como Ingeniero L√≠der Senior en Cox Automotive/Fyusion, forma parte clave del equipo de investigaci√≥n que desarrolla los sistemas automatizados de detecci√≥n de da√±os en veh√≠culos usados, tecnolog√≠a que hoy se usa en miles de subastas de autos en Estados Unidos. A lo largo de su carrera, tambi√©n ha creado instalaciones de realidad mixta en diversos espacios, desde festivales de m√∫sica hasta galer√≠as de arte p√∫blico.

¬øDe qu√© va la charla?

A trav√©s de la historia del desarrollo de la modelaci√≥n de transporte, que comenz√≥ en la d√©cada de los 50, se explorar√° c√≥mo es que la ideolog√≠a del momento, los supuestos utilizados, el uso en la pr√°ctica de los modelos, as√≠ como la tecnolog√≠a y la informaci√≥n disponible terminaron dictando c√≥mo se desarrollaron nuestras ciudades por m√°s de siete d√©cadas. ‚Å†Cada modelo es una serie de supuestos que se dise√±an para responder preguntas espec√≠ficas, y si no conocemos la teor√≠a y el contexto hist√≥rico en el que se formaron estos supuestos, nos condenamos a repetir los mismos errores: a crear m√°s profec√≠as autocumplidas, m√°s sistemas viciosos y m√°s proyectos fallidos.

description:

### **Elixir y Rust: Dos filosof√≠as, retos comunes**

### **1\. Introducci√≥n: Filosof√≠as distintas\, retos comunes**

* ¬øPor qu√© comparar Elixir y Rust?
* Breve historia: Erlang/BEAM vs Rust/LLVM

***

### **2\. Concurrencia: BEAM vs Tokio/async**

***

### **3\. Resiliencia y tolerancia a fallos**

* ¬øC√≥mo se modela algo similar en Rust?
* Cu√°ndo importa la resiliencia vs el rendimiento crudo

***

description:
Luis Carlos Osorio Jayk va a platicar en nuestro meetup de junio 2025.

En esta charla, nos sumergiremos en el mundo de la programaci√≥n as√≠ncrona en Rust, utilizando como herramienta principal el popular runtime Tokio. Exploraremos los fundamentos, comenzando por diferenciar entre **Tasks** y **Threads** y c√≥mo Rust gestiona la concurrencia y el paralelismo. A trav√©s de ejemplos pr√°cticos y sencillos, se podr√° entender el uso de las macros **join!** y **select!** para orquestar operaciones as√≠ncronas de manera eficiente.

üéôÔ∏è Dos exposiciones t√©cnicas con [Carlo Gilmar](www.linkedin.com/in/carlogilmar/) y [Jos√© Juan Reyes](https://github.com/neodevelop)
üí¨ Aprende c√≥mo Elixir y la BEAM VM est√°n transformando el desarrollo moderno, desde arquitectura hasta procesamiento de datos en producci√≥n.

\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-

üé§ **The Elixir Developer: Otra forma de entender el software**

**Ponente:** [Carlo Gilmar](https://www.linkedin.com/in/carlogilmar/) ‚Äì Tech speaker, desarrollador, consultor y formador especializado en Elixir y arquitectura resiliente.

‚òéÔ∏è Sab√≠as que proyectos gigantes como WhatsApp o Discord usan una tecnolog√≠a distinta para escalar sus aplicaciones? Hoy en d√≠a compa√±√≠as como Estee Lauder o Pepsico est√°n construyendo sus sistemas usando el poder de Elixir y la m√°quina virtual de Erlang. ¬øTe gustar√≠a saber por qu√©?
üöÄ En esta charla te contar√© una historia que pocos conocen: c√≥mo un lenguaje nacido en las telecomunicaciones en los a√±os 80 y su poderosa m√°quina virtual siguen resolviendo los retos m√°s actuales de escalabilidad, distribuci√≥n y resiliencia. Y c√≥mo Elixir, con su enfoque moderno y su sintaxis amigable, nos abre la puerta a todo ese poder ‚Äîsin complicarnos la vida.
üí° No necesitas saber nada de Elixir (ni de Erlang). Si te gusta aprender cosas nuevas, si te pica la curiosidad sobre c√≥mo funcionan las apps que usamos todos los d√≠as, o si simplemente est√°s buscando un lenguaje que te haga pensar distinto y dise√±ar mejor... esta charla es para ti.

**üìå¬øDe qu√© hablaremos durante esta charla?**
‚Ä¢‚Å† ‚Å†Historia de Erlang y Elixir
‚Ä¢‚Å† ‚Å†C√≥mo iniciar tu aventura en Elixir y qu√© retos encontrar√°s
‚Ä¢‚Å† ‚Å†Frameworks y tooling que ofrece el ecosistema
‚Ä¢‚Å† ‚Å†C√≥mo puedes aprovechar el poder de la m√°quina virtual BEAMüß™

üß† **Ideal para:**
‚Ä¢‚Å† ‚Å†Aquellos curiosos que quieren explorar nuevas herramientas y lenguajes.
‚Ä¢‚Å† ‚Å†Quienes han escuchado de Elixir o Erlang pero no saben por d√≥nde empezar.
‚Ä¢‚Å† ‚Å†Devs frontend, backend o fullstack que quieren mejorar la forma en que dise√±an y piensan sus sistemas.
‚Ä¢‚Å† ‚Å†Entusiastas del software que disfrutan entender c√≥mo funcionan las cosas "por dentro".

\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-

üöÄ **De Enum a Broadway: Domina los flujos de datos en Elixir**

**Ponente:** [Jos√© Juan Reyes](https://github.com/neodevelop) ‚Äì Desarrollador backend y open source contributor con experiencia en sistemas distribuidos y flujos de datos en producci√≥n.
Elixir no solo es elegante, tambi√©n es bastante eficiente. Aprende c√≥mo manejar flujos de datos, desde colecciones simples hasta pipelines de alto rendimiento en producci√≥n.
üîç **Qu√© cubriremos:**

* üõ†Ô∏è Enum: Funciones esenciales para manejar colecciones finitas de datos de manera sencilla y r√°pida.
* üåä Stream: Procesamiento eficiente y perezoso de grandes colecciones, optimizando memoria y rendimiento.
* ‚öôÔ∏è GenStage: Manejo avanzado de flujos as√≠ncronos, ideal para producir y consumir eventos.
* üå™Ô∏è Flow: Extensi√≥n de GenStage que simplifica el procesamiento paralelo de datos complejos.
* üéØ Broadway: Framework potente construido sobre GenStage para manejar pipelines escalables, tolerantes a fallos y optimizados para producci√≥n.

üß™ **Ejemplos pr√°cticos:**

* Cargar y procesar un CSV de 1M de registros usando `Stream`.
* Crear un pipeline `GenStage` con productores y consumidores desacoplados.
* Construir una app de ingesta con `Broadway` y ver c√≥mo escala sin caer.

üß† **Ideal para:**
Equipos t√©cnicos, devs que trabajan con datos, y quienes buscan construir sistemas que escalen sin sacrificar claridad ni mantenimiento.

\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-

title: thedatapub|Data Pub Abril: Responsible AI to Benefit Society, Use Cases and Lessons Learned|M√©xico|Ciudad de M√©xico
description:
¬°Parroquian@s! üëã

**Este mes de abril tendremos un meetup el jueves 24, y nos complace anunciar la participaci√≥n de Kit Rodolfa, PhD, quien es Director de Investigaci√≥n en el Laboratorio de Regulaci√≥n, Evaluaci√≥n y Gobernanza (RegLab) de Stanford, con la charla:**

**Responsible AI to Benefit Society: Use Cases and Lessons Learned**

*(La charla es es ingl√©s)*

¬øDe qu√© va la charla?

Las herramientas de Inteligencia Artificial (IA) y Aprendizaje Autom√°tico (ML) est√°n encontrando cada vez m√°s aplicaciones en una amplia gama de contextos de alto impacto social y decisiones cr√≠ticas. Cuando se implementan de manera cuidadosa, estas herramientas tienen el potencial de modernizar la prestaci√≥n de servicios gubernamentales y superar desaf√≠os hist√≥ricos como la falta de personal, el rezago en la atenci√≥n de casos y los procesos ineficientes. Sin embargo, cuando se aplican sin cuidado, pueden generar o agravar riesgos que perjudiquen justamente a las personas a las que estos programas est√°n destinados a ayudar.

Esta charla ofrecer√° una visi√≥n general de las lecciones aprendidas a partir de varios estudios de caso sobre la aplicaci√≥n de la IA y el ML en distintos contextos de pol√≠ticas p√∫blicas, que van desde la mejora de la infraestructura urbana hasta la protecci√≥n ambiental y la prestaci√≥n de servicios sociales para romper ciclos de encarcelamiento.

\-\-\-

What is the talk about?

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) tools are finding growing applications in a wide range of high-stakes, socially-impactful settings. When deployed thoughtfully, these tools hold the promise of modernizing government service delivery and overcoming long-standing challenges of insufficient staffing, case backlogs, and inefficient processes; but when applied carelessly, they can introduce or exacerbate risks of harms to the very individuals these programs are designed to serve. This talk will provide a survey of lessons learned from several case studies of applying AI and ML across policy settings ranging from improving city infrastructure to environmental protection to social service delivery to break cycles of incarceration.

\-\-\-

La cita es este pr√≥ximo jueves 24 de abril (2025) a las **7:00 pm (Hora de Ciudad de M√©xico)** en "Escuela de Gobierno y Transformaci√≥n P√∫blica del Tecnol√≥gico de Monterrey" [https://goo.gl/maps/eD5acVqaZ5MamH6T6](https://goo.gl/maps/eD5acVqaZ5MamH6T6) para aquellos que est√©n en la CDMX y tambi√©n estaremos haciendo streaming del evento por nuestro canal de YouTube:

[https://www.youtube.com/c/TheDataPubChannel](https://www.youtube.com/c/TheDataPubChannel/videos).

¬°Esperamos verlos por ac√°!

* 8:45pm - 10:00pm Chelas, pizzas y networking!

title: thedatapub|Data Pub Marzo: Before jumping to Large Language Models|M√©xico|Ciudad de M√©xico
description:
¬°Parroquian@s! üëã

**Este mes de marzo, tendremos un Meetup el jueves 27, y nos complace anunciar la participaci√≥n de Liliana Mill√°n N√∫√±ez, quien es muy conocida y querida por esta comunidad. Con la charla:**

**Before jumping to LLMs (Large Language Models)**

¬øDe qu√© va la charla?

Los modelos de lenguaje han transformado la IA, redefiniendo la manera en que interactuamos con la tecnolog√≠a en diversas industrias. Hace apenas cinco a√±os, era impensable pedirle a un agente de IA que generara un diagrama a partir de instrucciones o resolviera una ecuaci√≥n con una explicaci√≥n paso a paso. Sin embargo, a pesar de su poder, los modelos de lenguaje no siempre son la mejor soluci√≥n. En esta charla, exploraremos por qu√© el contexto es clave para lograr los mejores resultados en quienes se ven afectados por soluciones de IA y por qu√© las decisiones deben estar impulsadas por el problema en s√≠, no por la tecnolog√≠a.

\-\-\-

What is the talk about?

LLMs have transformed AI, reshaping how we interact with technology across industries. Just five years ago, it was unimaginable to ask an AI agent to generate a diagram from instructions or solve an equation with a step-by-step explanation. Yet, despite their power, LLMs are not always the best solution. In this talk, we explore why context is crucial for achieving the best outcomes for those affected by AI solutions and why decisions should be driven by the problem itself‚Äînot the technology.

\-\-\-

title: thedatapub|Data Pub Febrero: ML Informed Financial Assistance to Prevent Homelessness|M√©xico|Ciudad de M√©xico
description:
¬°Parroquian@s! üëã

Este mes de febrero, tenemos un Meetup el jueves 27 y nos complace anunciar la participaci√≥n de **Kasun Amarasinghe**, quien ha sido ponente en ediciones anteriores del **Data Day**, con la charla titulada:

**Machine Learning Informed Financial Assistance to Prevent Homelessness**

IMPORTANTE \*\*La charla es en ingl√©s\*\*

¬øDe qu√© va la charla?

A medida que la brecha entre los costos de vivienda y los niveles de ingresos contin√∫a creciendo, un n√∫mero cada vez mayor de hogares tiene dificultades para pagar el alquiler, eventualmente enfrenta el desalojo y, en algunos casos, experimenta la falta de vivienda. (En EE. UU.) Los gobiernos locales implementan Programas de Asistencia para el Alquiler para proporcionar ayuda financiera temporal a los inquilinos que tienen dificultades para pagar su renta, con el objetivo de mantenerlos en una vivienda estable y prevenir la falta de hogar. Sin embargo, a medida que aumenta el n√∫mero de hogares vulnerables y los fondos para estos programas de asistencia siguen siendo limitados, los administradores deben decidir qu√© hogares recibir√°n ayuda. Aunque identificar y priorizar a las personas m√°s vulnerables es una preocupaci√≥n clave, la pr√°ctica com√∫n consiste en distribuir la asistencia utilizando heur√≠sticas simples, como el criterio de ‚Äúprimero en llegar, primero en ser atendido‚Äù. En esta charla, describir√© un esfuerzo colaborativo entre nuestro equipo en la Universidad Carnegie Mellon y el Departamento de Servicios Humanos del Condado de Allegheny, en el que examinamos la utilidad de utilizar un enfoque basado en Aprendizaje Autom√°tico (ML) para priorizar la asignaci√≥n de asistencia para el alquiler y minimizar la falta de vivienda causada por desalojos. Explicar√© c√≥mo convertimos el problema de pol√≠tica en un problema de ML, c√≥mo se desarroll√≥ y evalu√≥ el sistema de ML en un entorno coherente con el contexto de implementaci√≥n, el dise√±o y despliegue de la prueba de validaci√≥n en el campo, y las lecciones que aprendimos a lo largo del proceso.

\-\-\-

What is the talk about?

As the gap between housing costs and income levels continues to grow, an increasing number of households struggle to pay rent, eventually face eviction, and, in some cases, experience homelessness. (In the US) Local governments implement Rental Assistance Programs to provide temporary financial assistance to renters struggling to pay their rent to keep them stably housed and prevent homelessness. However, as the number of vulnerable households increases and funding for rental assistance programs remains limited, program administrators must decide which households will receive help. Although identifying and prioritizing the most vulnerable individuals is a top concern, the typical practice is distributing assistance using simple heuristics such as first-come-first-served. In this talk, I will describe a collaborative effort between our team at Carnegie Mellon University and the Allegheny County Department of Human Services that examined the utility of using Machine Learning (ML)-based prioritization of rental assistance allocation to minimize eviction-caused homelessness. I will describe how we mapped the policy problem to an ML problem, how the ML system was developed and evaluated in a setting consistent with the deployment context, the deployment and design of the field validation trial, and the lessons we learned throughout the process.

\-\-\-

La cita es este pr√≥ximo jueves 27 de febrero (2025) a las **7:00 pm (Hora de Ciudad de M√©xico)** en "Escuela de Gobierno y Transformaci√≥n P√∫blica del Tecnol√≥gico de Monterrey" [https://goo.gl/maps/eD5acVqaZ5MamH6T6](https://goo.gl/maps/eD5acVqaZ5MamH6T6) para aquellos que est√©n en la CDMX y tambi√©n estaremos haciendo streaming del evento por nuestro canal de YouTube:

[https://www.youtube.com/c/TheDataPubChannel](https://www.youtube.com/c/TheDataPubChannel/videos).

¬°Recuerden que al final tendremos networking üåê!

¬°Esperamos verlos por ac√°!

La agenda es la siguiente:

* 7:00pm - 7:30pm Bienvenida y Anuncios
* 7:30pm - 8:45pm ML Informed Financial Assistance to Prevent Homelessness
* 8:45pm - 10:00pm Chelas, pizzas y networking!

Pueden ir reservando su espacio registr√°ndose en el evento.

\*El lugar cuenta con estacionamiento $50 pesos tiempo indefinido.

¬°Esperamos verlos por ac√°!
\- Data Pub

title: thedatapub|Data Pub Enero: Predicciones de riesgo global (2¬∞ lugar Factored Datathon 2024)|M√©xico|Ciudad de M√©xico
description:
¬°Parroquian@s! üëã

**¬°Estamos de regreso para este 2025!**

Esta vez tendremos a C√©sar Arroyo C√°rdenas con la charla:

**Predicciones de riesgo global: Segundo lugar del Factored Datathon 2024**

¬øDe qu√© va la charla?

En esta charla exploraremos el proyecto ganador del segundo lugar del Factored Datathon 2024 ganado por LatamFusion. Esta soluci√≥n, desarrollada en solo 2 semanas, comprende un flujo completo de un proyecto predictivo de datos masivos. Desde la descarga de datos, pasando por la ingesta diaria de nuevos datos, y un flujo totalmente automatizado que va desde los datos crudos hasta la generaci√≥n de alertas mediante la predicci√≥n de series de tiempo. El proyecto us√≥ tecnolog√≠as tan variadas como Azure Functions, Docker, SQL Server, CI/CD, Machine Learning, Databricks, entre otros. Finalmente, la informaci√≥n se hizo visible a partir de un aplicativo web desarrollado en Streamlit.

La base de todo el proyecto fue el Global Database of Events, Language, and Tone (GDELT). Este compila noticias de todo el mundo en diferentes formatos como radio, prensa y noticias web, y en m√°s de 100 lenguajes. Mantenido por Google Jigsaw, y abierto a descarga para cualquier persona u organizaci√≥n, el proyecto GDELT busca dar una visi√≥n global del estado actual de las diferentes naciones y sociedades alrededor del mundo. Mediante el procesamiento diario de las noticias se identifican actores, eventos, temas, y emociones; siendo de forma efectiva una plataforma abierta para el entendimiento del mundo.

Adem√°s de los detalles t√©cnicos, necesarios para lograr un objetivo tan competitivo, se har√° una reflexi√≥n sobre las caracter√≠sticas y pr√°cticas que llev√≥ el equipo para la consecuci√≥n de este logro.

[https://www.youtube.com/c/TheDataPubChannel](https://www.youtube.com/c/TheDataPubChannel/videos).

title: mexico-city-unity-user-group|Webinar: Optimizing game performance with culling techniques|Online
description:
(\*You must register for this webinar using the link below. RSVPing through meetup will not get you access)

Culling in game development refers to the process of selectively rendering objects, so only objects that are visible to the camera appear in game. By effectively managing what‚Äôs being displayed on screen at any given time, you can significantly enhance the performance of your project.

On **Tuesday, September 10, at 12 pm ET / 9 am PT**, join us for a free webinar exploring three culling techniques in Unity. Anthony Rosenbaum, senior software development consultant, will show you the basics of Unity‚Äôs stock culling solutions: Umbra Occlusion Culling, the CullingGroup API, and Unity 6‚Äôs new GPU Occlusion Culling.

During the session, Anthony will also cover:

* Pros, cons, and setup of Unity‚Äôs stock culling solutions
* Memory vs. CPU vs. GPU tradeoffs
* Static vs. Dynamic culling
* GPU Occlusion debugging
* Mobile performance improvements enabled by culling techniques

[Register Now!](https://create.unity.com/culling-techniques-webinar)

description:
**DEFCON 32 termin√≥ üíîüíîüíî**

Hay quienes regresan c√≥modamente en un avi√≥n, y otros que pasan horas y horas con las manos al volante, pero el sentimiento es el mismo: la alegr√≠a de ver a los amigos de muchos a√±os, el dolor de cabeza por la resaca; la piel tostada de tanto calor y el triste sentimiento de regresar a la realidad.

Pero adi√≥s a la nostalgia, porque a√∫n nos queda el NoTrustSec (sin avi√≥n, sin volante, sin resaca y sin bronceado, pero con toda la actitud, los amigos y buenas charlas).

Esta vez el M√°ster **@KBrown (Sandino Araico)** nos mostrar√° un proyecto para **proteger tu E-Firma** en sistemas productivos, protegi√©ndola de los Navegadores, y adem√°s nos ense√±ar√° a integrar esta soluci√≥n con otros proyectos protegiendo toda la informaci√≥n con **‚Äúpg_enigma‚Äù**, una herramienta para En-cri-p-tar (¬°¬°¬°broma!!! :P ¬°cifrar! ¬°cifrar! ¬°cifrar!) a nivel columna en PostgreSQL; ahora si, tienes todo para estar tan protegido como la Mona Lisa.

A la pregunta constante de ¬øC√≥mo empiezo en ciberseguridad sin que me cueste un ojo de la cara o ser estafado? Estar√°n con nosotros **Julieta y Felipe del CONHACYT con H**, que nos platicar√°n sobre un Bootcamp con temas actualizados para salir como un Ninja con papeles oficiales.
Y para cerrar con m√°s acci√≥n y an√©cdotas, **Edgar Sandoval** nos har√° cerrar la mil veces resuelta m√°quina virtual de HackTheBox para poner manos al volante con el Hacking Out Of The Box, ¬°Por fin, Red Teaming como se debe hacer!, en el mundo f√≠sico, porque la seguridad no siempre es l√≥gica.

Estamos **MUY MUY** contentos!!! porque en esta ocasi√≥n cambiamos de sede para tener M√ÅS espacio y M√ÅS comodidad para poder conectar mejor, pasar un gran momento y conocer alguien nuevo **mientras compartimos unos bocadillos y una chelita o mezcal,** gracias a nuestros amigos de **Espacio Nativo**, que nos dar√°n asilo en su incre√≠ble lugar.
Como siempre con todo lo que es NoTrustSec, tu Meetup de seguridad favorito.

**La agilidad empresarial va m√°s all√° de implementar nuevas pr√°cticas y herramientas; es un cambio profundo en la forma en que una organizaci√≥n piensa, act√∫a y se adapta.**

**Reconocer la naturaleza de la agilidad es fundamental para una transformaci√≥n efectiva.** La agilidad no es un destino, sino un viaje continuo que implica flexibilidad, colaboraci√≥n y aprendizaje constante. Una transformaci√≥n √°gil exitosa requiere un entendimiento claro de c√≥mo las diferentes partes de la organizaci√≥n interact√∫an y se afectan mutuamente. Solo al comprender y aceptar esta naturaleza din√°mica, las empresas pueden crear entornos que fomenten la innovaci√≥n, mejoren la eficiencia y respondan r√°pidamente a las cambiantes demandas del mercado.

**Cuando decimos que algo es sist√©mico, nos referimos a que est√° interconectado y depende de una red de elementos que se influyen mutuamente.** En el contexto de la agilidad empresarial, entender su naturaleza sist√©mica es crucial. Esto implica reconocer que cada cambio, por peque√±o que sea, puede tener repercusiones significativas en otras √°reas de la organizaci√≥n. La agilidad sist√©mica requiere una visi√≥n donde se consideren tanto los procesos internos como las interacciones externas.

**Las decisiones no se toman de forma aislada, se eval√∫an en funci√≥n de su impacto global.** Este enfoque permite identificar y abordar problemas antes de que se conviertan en obst√°culos, asegurando una adaptaci√≥n fluida y sostenida en el tiempo.

**En esta Agile Talk aprender√°s m√°s sobre la esencia sist√©mica de la agilidad para aprovechar cada cambio, sin importar lo peque√±o que sea, para elevar el impacto en la transformaci√≥n y sobre todo, en los resultados.**

DESPUES DE UNAS LARGAS VACACIONES, REGRESAMOS!

No estabamos perdidos, solo nos tomamos un break en enero,pero ya estamos de vuelta con mas meetups chidos para la banda.
Este mes, tendremos una charla bastante buena por parte de los amigos de Grid Dynamics.

**De Batch a Tiempo Real: Mejorando Aplicaciones Java con Apache Kafka y ksqlDB**
La transici√≥n de procesamiento por lotes a flujos de datos en tiempo real puede ser un gran cambio de paradigma para las aplicaciones en Java. Esta presentaci√≥n se centra en c√≥mo Apache Kafka y ksqlDB pueden ser instrumentales en esta transici√≥n. Comenzaremos con una visi√≥n general de Kafka como una plataforma de transmisi√≥n de eventos distribuida y su importancia en las arquitecturas de datos modernas. Luego, nos adentraremos en c√≥mo ksqlDB simplifica el procesamiento de flujos, permitiendo a los desarrolladores construir aplicaciones en tiempo real directamente sobre Kafka utilizando consultas familiares similares a SQL.

Dario Gerardo Flores Luis es un Ingeniero de Software Staff, especializado en desarrollar algoritmos y sistemas computacionales dentro del sector TI. Posee un t√≠tulo en F√≠sica y una Maestr√≠a en Ciencia de Datos & Big Data, mostrando su experiencia en varios lenguajes de programaci√≥n y tecnolog√≠as. description:

Para el que no lo tuviera claro... las reuniones se suspendieron por todo el tema de la *pandemia*, debido a eso ‚Äîde forma precautoria‚Äî la reuni√≥n se llevar√° a cabo al aire libre, el uso de tapabocas queda a criterio individual, sin embargo se les exhorta a respetar las precauciones que cada quien tome. El COVID impacto de muchas formas nuestras vidas y las necesidades de cuidados a la salud var√≠an mucho de persona a persona. Se espera respeto y empat√≠a entre los asistentes.

Nuestras reuniones son una plataforma para la colaboraci√≥n entre los asistentes, fomentando el compartir experiencias, conocimientos y vincular a la comunidad local, buscando mantener un ambiente informal y relajado, a la vez que fomenta las discusiones t√©cnicas especializadas, con todo el rigor que el tema necesite.

El formato de la reuni√≥n es el regular: dos charlas, networking, bebidas y snacks (sin patrocinador, pero el que guste llevar, bienvenido sea).

**Uno Platform 4.0 ‚Äì putting the ‚ÄúPlatform in Uno Platform‚Äù**

So far you would have known of Uno Platform for its UI unique capabilities ‚Äì enabling C# and XAML single-codebase apps to run on Web, iOS, Android, macOS, Windows and Linux.

But now the open-source Uno Platform also brings plethora of new capabilities such as:

* Figma plugin ‚Äì for one-click XAML generation from Figma designs
* Extensions ‚Äì for bootstrapping your apps faster
* Toolkit ‚Äì for common cross-platform controls such as Navigation Bar or TabBar
* VS Code Plugin ‚Äì for Intelisense-like experience for XAML and C# completion, Hot Reload and more

In this session we will cover some of the Uno Platform fundamentals and then provide a deep dive on all additional Uno Platform capabilities that came in 4.0 wave.

Abstract:
Apache Kafka es un proyecto muy popular utilizado por muchas organizaciones para conectar sistemas, construir microservicios, para data mesh, etc. Sin embargo, como sistema distribuido, comprender su rendimiento es un reto, demasiadas partes m√≥viles.

En esta charla, revisaremos los componentes claves (productores, consumidores, replicaci√≥n, red, etc.), compartiremos una estrategia para medir e interpretar los resultados de rendimiento de consumidores y productores junto a una gu√≠a general para ayudar a interpretar los resultados.

Si asistes te llevar√°s a casa un m√©todo probado para medir, evaluar y optimizar el rendimiento de una infraestructura basada en Apache Kafka. Una requisito clave para projectos de baja latencia y alto rendimiento, pero especialmente para las implementaciones de mayor escala.

Bio:
Pere es Arquitecto de Soluciones en Confluent, desde Berlin en Alemania. Habiendo trabajado en sistema y arquitectura de datos por mor de 15 a√±os como freelance y consultor. En estos roles ha trabajado de forma principal en sistemas de procesamiento de datos y b√∫squeda, ayudando empresas a construir arquitecturas de datos resilientes y escalables.

El trabajo normalmente es a medio camino entre la infraestructura, los ingenieros y los cient√≠ficos de datos, ontolog√≠as y producto.

En el pasado, siendo parte de Elastic, la empresa detr√°s de Elasticsearch, ayudando empresas en sistemas de operaciones. Cuando no est√° en el trabajo a Pere le encanta pasar tiempo con la familia, ni√±os y disfrutar de un buen partido de Balonmano.

title: guadalajara-kafka|KIP (Kafka Improvement Proposal) 500 (En espa√±ol)|Online
description:

-----

*Time below in Mexico City time - to find out when the event is in your timezone follow this link: http://www.worldtimebuddy.com/event?lid=3530597%2C100&h=100&sts=27044640&sln=16-17&a=show

Agenda:
11:00am-11:05am: Online Networking
11:05am-11:50am: Raul Estrada (En espa√±ol)
11:50am: Log in or Join our Forum (forum.confluent.io) to ask any follow up questions!

-----
Speakers: Raul Estrada

Talk: KIP (Kafka Improvement Proposal) 500

Durante el Kafka Summit del 12 de Mayo de 2021, se present√≥ la implementaci√≥n del protocolo Raft en Kafka (llamado K-Raft) para reemplazar el uso de Zookeeper.

El KIP (Kafka Improvement Proposal) 500 establece la visi√≥n de Kafka sin Zookeeper. Sin embargo, incluso sin Zookeeper, la necesidad de consenso nunca desaparece. En esta charla, se discute una de las iniciativas centrales de la comunidad de Kafka, un protocolo nativo similar a Raft que se use para garantizar que diferentes servidores se pongan de acuerdo sobre la sincronizaci√≥n de los metadatos y cu√°les r√©plicas est√°n disponibles para escritura (es decir, ser l√≠deres de partici√≥n).

Espec√≠ficamente, se cubren los siguientes temas:
Por qu√© la comunidad abandon√≥ el consenso externo y qu√© beneficios brinda el consenso interno.
En qu√© se diferencia el protocolo K-Raft del Raft est√°ndar y las consideraciones de dise√±o en su implementaci√≥n.
C√≥mo funciona el nuevo Quorum Controller y c√≥mo se integra con el protocolo Raft
Cu√°les son los siguientes pasos para el protocolo de replicaci√≥n de Kafka para metadatos.

Bio:
Raul is a programmer specialized in massive data processing pipelines. Also, he has experience with Scala, Kotlin, Java, Elixir and Go programming languages.

Since 2015 Raul is co-organizer of the Java Mexico Meetup. Also he is co-organizer of the Kafka Mexico Meetup, GoLang Mexico Meetup and author of several books related to data engineering and Kafka.

He loves to talk about Kafka, Kafka streams, KSQL and all the technologies related to massive data processing like Spark and Flink.

Raul is also a Confluent Community Catalyst (Class of 2020 - 2021).

---

Online Meetup Etiquette:
‚Ä¢Please hold your questions until the end of the presentation or use the zoomchat during!

-----
Speaker: Pere Urbon-Bayes

Title: Building a self-service Kafka platform as a service with Gitops

Abstract: Have you ever wondered, what motivates people? According to many authors, autonomy is a key factor to build a sustainable and motivated team. This is as well a core principle of the devops.

If you are in the quest of building a self-service kafka based platform where your users can manage topics, acls and rbac by themself, but still keep change control and a verification process? Gitops and Kafka Topology Builder is here to help you.

In this talk we're going to present and guide you towards the steps necessary to build up a self-service Apache Kafka using Gitops and Kafka Topology Builder, including a few war stories from people using it in production.

By the end of this talk, you will take home an automatic Jenkins pipeline, that will make your users autonomous and give you more time to focus on less bureaucratic work.

Bio: Pere is a Software Engineer for Confluent out of Berlin, Germany. He has been working with data and architecting systems for more than 15 years as a freelance engineer and consultant. In that role he was focused on data processing and search, helping companies build reliable and scalable data architectures. His work sits at the crossroad of infrastructure, data engineers and scientists, ontologist and product. Prior to that he was part of Elastic, the company behind Elasticsearch, where he was part of the Logstash team, helping companies build reliable ingestion pipelines into Elasticsearch. When not working, Pere loves to spend time with his lovely wife and kids.
